bad take, there is only a single valid technical reason not to do L2 (instant finality, which is in the works) but even that can be mitigated (trivially) to a large extent

or you use Celestia DA + zk bridge & you're still an L2 w/ single (Celestia) block finality (& migrate to blobs when single slot finality lands on Ethereum)

all these setups will be much better than the fully permissioned validator chain that Tempo will be for a long time - they're basically set up to be Hedera
